description.html:
Dear Co-Found Berlin Members, 

Welcome to our 2nd Annual SUMMER EVENT!

With Great Pleasure... We're excited to bring to you another event to remember!!  Hosted by CLYC and Sponsored by RAUE... Atop Potsdamer Platz, with great food, drinks and the best panoramic terrace and view in Berlin.

We look forward to welcoming You all very soon. 

We will have limited capacity for this event and all those who wish to attend, Must be members of Co-Found Berlin on Meetup and Purchase Ticket here on Eventbrite or will not be permitted to join us. 

http://www.meetup.com/Co-Found-Berlin/events/224090683/

It's been said that the number 1 cause of start-up failure is the Team.... Whether you are a budding start-up on the rise open to meet talented Co-Founders to join your team or a talented and skilled individual looking to take the leap, make your mark and be apart of the next big thing. The Problem is, there is a lack of resources to connect these two sides organically, and to meet good people with complimenting skills in an inviting environment is in itself difficult. That's where Co-Found comes in. We help in creating that environment for you to meet face to face to attract potential Co-Founders and Start-ups that spark your interest, To help you make a connection and form the next great team that goes down in start-up history. YOU: Aspiring Entrepreneurs, Corporate & Business people, Freelancers, Consultants, Inventors, Hardware Engineers, Software Engineers, Hackers, Developers, Designers, Creatives, Students, and most importantly Start-ups of all shapes, sizes and stages Are Welcomed! ... We look forward to meeting YOU...

description.html:
GASTRO-GRÜNDERTAG: EIN TAG FÜR GASTRONOMIE START-UPS!
für Foodies | Gründer | Gastronomen | Newcomer | Interessierte


Ein Universalrezept für die Gründung in der Gastronomie? Gibt es nicht!
Am Gastro-Gründertag kommen Experten und Gründer zusammen, um über ihre Erfahrungen zu sprechen und voneinander zu lernen. Denn genau das wollen wir an diesem Tag tun – mit interessanten Diskussionen, Vorträgen und Panel mit Experten!


Ein klitzekleiner Vorgeschmack auf das Programm

Spannende Diskussionen mit Publikumsfragen
Etablierte Gastronomen wie Cynthia Barcomi (Barcomi's), Heinz 'Cookie' Gindullis und Ansgar Oberholz (St. Oberholz) teilen ihre Erfahrungen und Branchenkenner wie Sophia Hoffmann (Oh, Sophia!), Jan-Peter Wulf (nomyblog, dasfilter), Stephanie Rothenhöfer (Food Entrepreneurs Club) und Oskar Melzer (Mogg & Melzer) blicken in die Zukunft der Food-Szene und deren Trends.


Informative Vorträge
Gastronomieexperten wie Vanessa Koch, Björn Welter (Pret A Manger, Wonderpots), Sandro Spiess (Eventbrite), Patrick Brienen (orderbird) und Erich Nagl (ETL ADHOGA) glänzen in ihrem Fach und geben Gründern wertvolle Tipps zum Umgang mit Gästen, Branding, Finanzen und neuen Technologien.


Beratung
Direkter Rat von den Experten: Gastronomen erhalten persönliche Beratung zu Gründung, Finanzen, Branding, Marketing, Cafékonzepten, Eventmarkting und mehr.

// Das vollständige Programm wird in den kommenden Wochen veröffentlicht. //


Wir danken unseren Partnern und Sponsoren





Appetit auf mehr? Dann schau vobei!

www.gastro-gruenderpreis.de
Facebook

description.html:
Lesbians Who Tech is a global community

of over 10,000 queer women (and allies) in tech.

To learn more go to Lesbianswhotech.org

 

Lesbians Who Tech is a community of queer women in tech (and allies) that started in San Francisco in December 2012. Since then, we’ve built a community of over 9,000 queer women in 22 cities, including 4 international cities.


 

Lesbians Who Tech Press // 

  • If Every Tech Conference Were Like Lesbians Who Tech, Tech Would Be A Much Better Place // BuzzFeed 
  • What it’s like to be a Lesbian in Tech // Fortune 
  • Second Annual “Lesbians Who Tech” Summit Ups the Ante // Autostraddle 
  • At Lesbians Who Tech, Silicon Valley is here and it's queer // DailyDot

description.html:
Too often, founders work on ideas that can never make it, no matter how passionate they are. Problems might be a twisted market, wrong perception of user needs, the fact that it has been tried n times before and always failed, and many other caveats that are best identified BEFORE starting to put serious effort into an idea.

That's why G-Force is a bi-weekly, 20-attendees-maximum event to either  

a) show and tell your startup or product idea in order to get tough feedback BEFORE you begin to seriously put work and money into it. The feedback you get might either be a strong suggestion to reconsider or even fold your idea - or highly valuable advice on the next most useful steps to turn it into reality. There's no need for you to prepare a slide deck or follow any "elevator pitch" rule; just tell us what you're working on.

b) come as a guest to hear what other founders in Berlin are working on, learn how to discover critical challenges and questions about ideas yourself, and maybe even join the team of an idea you particularly like.


Mentoring and advising founders at conferences globally, Berlin Startup Academy CEO and German Technology Entrepreneurship Center co-founder Christoph is also the author of Business Punk magazine's startup review section. The feedback you get will be powerful and meaningful, guaranteed. If you're on to something good, there's an option to talk about participation in the upcoming GTEC Berlin Startup Academy program.

description.html:
Ein Workshop rund um die Hard- und Software "Native Instruments Maschine 2.0". Erlernt werden alle grundlegenden Funktionen und Arbeitsabläufe um "Maschine" ohne Computer-Bildschirm zu bedienen.


INHALTE:
Einrichten der Maschine-Hardware 

Erläuterung der Maschine-Terminologie: Groups, Slots, Sounds, Module, FX, Patterns, Scenes

Grundlegende Bedienung der Maschine-Hardware: 

Überblick über die verschiedenen Parameter des Sampler-Moduls Verwendung von REX-Dateien Verwaltung von Groups Verwendung und Verwaltung von Effekten

Überblick und Erläuterung der verschiedenen Effekte:

 Kompression, Filter, Hall, Verzerrung, Modulation etc.  Erste Schritte mit dem Sequenzer: Step-Sequencing, Aufnahme eigener Sequenzen in Echtzeit


Sampling von externen Audio-Signalen  

Arrangieren eigener Songs  

Nutzung des Maschine-VST-Plug-Ins in anderen Audio-Programmen


Zielgruppe: 

Der Kurs richtet sich an alle Einsteiger, welche auf schnellstem Weg das volle Potential von Native Instruments Maschine ausschöpfen möchten.
 

!!!!ACHTUNG!!!!
Bringt Eure eigene Maschine mit. Falls Ihr keine eigene Maschine habt, informiert uns bitte vorher.

Preis: 169,-- €

A: Wir haben eine Klimaanlage im Studio. In der Regel ist es angenehm kühl.

F: Gibt es Verpflegung? Kann ich selbst etwas mitbringen?
A: Wir haben einen Verkaufsstand für Snacks und Getränke. Es können aber auch eigene nicht-alkoholische Getränke und Essen mitgebracht werden. 

F: Kann ich Fanartikel vor Ort kaufen?
A: Ja, wir haben einen Verkaufsstand mit Fanartikeln im Studio.

F: Wie komme ich mit öffentlichen Verkehrsmitteln zum Studio?
A: Am einfachsten Ihr nehmt die S-Bahn Linien 8, 9, 45, 46 oder 85 und steigt an der Haltestelle Adlershof aus. Eine Übersicht über Berlins Liniennetz findet ihr hier. Von der Haltestelle braucht ihr etwa zehn Minuten zu Fuß zum Studio.

F: Gibt es in der Nähe vom Studio Hotels?
A: Es gibt mehrere Hotels in der Nähe vom Studio. Besucher der LCS können zu einer vergünstigten Rate im Dorint Adlershof Berlin unter diesem Link buchen. Zusätzlich gibt es bei Vorlage des Tickets bei Anreise einen 10% Rabatt auf das Speisen- und Getränkeangebot im Hotel, sowie auf Anfrage und nach Verfügbarkeit einen Late Check Out bis 16.00 Uhr.

F: Wo kann ich parken?
A: Leider haben wir keinen Parkplatz am Studio, aber es sollten genug Plätze in der Nähe frei sein.

Watch Europe's best teams battle in the EU LCS!

Doors open an hour before the first scheduled game start. Go to lolesports.com for more info and the match schedule. You can find photos of the event on our Flickr page.
If you have questions or concerns related to tickets or ticket sales, please call Lukas Peda or Albert Rojo at +49 (0)170 3852700 (Monday through Friday 11:00 - 19:00 CET) or contact us through Eventbrite's mailing system. 

Tickets FAQ 

Q: Do I have to print the ticket? Do I have to bring Photo ID?
A: You can print your ticket or bring it on your smartphone. We will need your ID, if you do not have a copy of your ticket

Q: Is there an age requirement?
A: Children under the age of 12 are required to be accompanied by an adult.

Q: When should I arrive? What if I am late?
A: Audience load in is at 16:00. The first match starts at 17:00. No worries if you are late there will always be someone available to check you in. 

Q: How is seating arranged?
A: There is bleacher seating on a first come first serve basis. If you want to sit with your friends, please make sure to arrive early.

Q: What is the temperature like in the studio?
A: We have air conditioning in the studio. Usually it is pleasantly cool. 

Q: Is there food for sale? Can I bring my own?
A: There is a concession stand in the studio that has various food items for sale. You can also bring your own non-alcoholic drinks and foods to the studio.

Q: Is there merchandise for sale?
A: Yes, there is a merchandise store in the studio.

Q: How do I get to the studio with public transportation?
A: The easiest way to get to the studio are the S-Bahn trails 8, 9, 45, 46 and 85. Get off the train at the station Adlershof. You can find a map of Berlin's train system here. From station Adlershof it is a ten minute walk to studio K/L. 

Q: Are there hotels near the studio?
A: There are several hotels near the studio. Attendees of the LCS can book at a discounted rate in the Dorint Adlershof Berlin using this link. You get 10% off of food and beverages in the hotel, if you show the LCS ticket upon arrival. Additionally, late check out is possible till 16:00 upon request and availability.  

Q: Is there parking?
A: Unfortunately, we have no parking available at the studio, but you can find space nearby.

description.html:
ART MEETS MUSIC AT BERGHAIN #TurnAroundBerghain

Not unlike Bonnie Tyler in the iconic Total Eclipse of the Heart video, enter Berlin's impenetrable boys boarding school of techno and life, watch the spectacle of digital art and live music, experience light and obscurity, come out a different person with an acute sense for rampant beauty and the uncanny.
"Once upon a time there was light in my life, but now there's only love in the dark,
Nothing I can say, a total eclipse of the heart." 

Live music by Koudlam, Hyenaz & Peter Kirn, art by Jamie Harley, Lisa Wassmann, Natacha Mankowski, Actually Huizenga, Boris Eldagsen,  Martin Müller, Peaches & many more.
Full lineup & partners on http://turnaroundberghain.tumblr.com

description.html:
At Wear It Festival tech entrepreneurs, designers, companies, investors, scientists and media representatives meet to present, and experience, the most exciting innovations in the field of wearables. Wear It is a connect and develop initiative for future designers and companies and builds a bridge between ideas, products, people and capital. 

Today´s upraise of digitization in fashion and body-related technologies show brandnew developments in wearable electronics and fashion technologies. The Wear It Festival combines a relaxed atmosphere and enthusiasm with professionalism.

description.html:
Auf dem 13. Forum Wärmepumpe trifft sich auch in diesem Jahr die deutsche Wärmepumpenbranche, um über die politischen Rahmenbedingungen, technische Innovationen und die neuesten Trends zu diskutieren. Etwa 180 Personen aus Wirtschaft, Politik, Wissenschaft und Medien werden an zwei Tagen abwechslungsreiche Vorträge hören, anregende Diskussionen führen und bei der Abendveranstaltung des ersten Tages in entspannter Atmosphäre Netzwerke pflegen. Das Forum Wärmepumpe ist die größte Einzelveranstaltung rund um die Zukunftstechnologie Wärmepumpe in Deutschland.

Informationen zu Programm, Anfahrt und Unterkunft finden Sie auf der Veranstaltungswebseite unter www.bwp-service.de.

description.html:
BETAPITCH | global & Investors Day
 

On August 29, BETAPITCH | global & Investors Day takes place in betahaus Berlin. BETAPITCH is a startup competition with amazing prizes, chances for investing and investment. It's also a platform for building up a relevant network, learning new things and exchanging ideas. To ensure you’ll get home inspired to the stars and with a handful of useful contacts, we’re organizing a BETAPITCH | Investors Day prior to the BETAPITCH | global pitches! Bonus points for startups as they get more space to talk to various investors and accelerators and find the best fitting one. Bonus points for investors, accelerators and cool corporates because they get to meet a selection of smart startups they may not yet know. (Bonus points for everyone else because there’s more to do, watch, enjoy and learn). 
 

When | 

The Investors Day takes place on August 29th, from 2 - 5pm at betahaus | Berlin, 4th floor, Innospace.  BETAPITCH | global starts at 6pm in the Innospace.

What | 

We’ll start off with the coolest startups on stage. After that we'll roast on stage some big and relevant investors and accelerators. Hear them out and bring your curious questions! After the panel discussions, we’ll continue the discussion in small groups so you can dive into an in-depth talk. Finally, you’ll be able to meet investors / startups privately in meeting rooms. There’ll be coffee, tea, wine and beer to smoothen things up.

At the BETAPITCH | global you'll see the best of the best - winners of all the local BETAPITCH events - pitching off for awesome prizes. In the game there's 5000€ from hub:raum, a fully sponsored trip to the Silicon Valley by Axel Springer Plug n' Play, $1000 on upwork and other perks from the community. The raddest jury, composed of investors, mentors and partners from the community, will decide which startup pitch deserves to win. 


More info and taking part | 

More info about the BETAPITCH | global and Investors Day is coming up at http://www.betapitch.net. Are you a startup or investor and you want to take part in the panel? Send us an e-mail at katka@betahaus.de



This BETAPITCH is made possible thanks to our sponsors and supporters:

description.html:
The CAPITAL project Final Experts Forum will take place in Berlin in parallel to the 10th edition of the annual Future Security Research Conference (FuSEC) organised by Fraunhofer.

This 1 day Forum will focus on the main results of the CAPITAL project and will unveil its highly anticipated European Cybersecurity Research Agenda to an audience gathering high-level European political representatives such as Public-Private NIS Platform stakeholders and various experts.

The CAPITAL Cybersecurity Research Agenda will contribute to the NIS Platform Working Group 3 Strategic Research Agenda.

Join us and all our experts to mark the end of the CAPITAL project and provide your insight on EU’s future Cybersecurity Research Agenda.

Attendance to this event is free of charge.

Registration to this event will allow you to benefit of a special rate to attend the Future Security Research Conference (FuSEC) on days 1 and 3. 

Registration to FuSEC is available at its online registration form . Any e-mail about FuSEC 2015 event must be sent exclusively to: info@future-security2015.de.

                        Mari Kert, EOS

description.text:
The CAPITAL project Final Experts Forum will take place in Berlin in parallel to the 10th edition of the annual Future Security Research Conference (FuSEC) organised by Fraunhofer. 
This 1 day Forum will focus on the main results of the CAPITAL project and will unveil its highly anticipated European Cybersecurity Research Agenda to an audience gathering high-level European political representatives such as Public-Private NIS Platform stakeholders and various experts. 
The CAPITAL Cybersecurity Research Agenda will contribute to the NIS Platform Working Group 3 Strategic Research Agenda. 
Join us and all our experts to mark the end of the CAPITAL project and provide your insight on EU’s future Cybersecurity Research Agenda. 
Attendance to this event is free of charge. 
Registration to this event will allow you to benefit of a special rate to attend the Future Security Research Conference (FuSEC) on days 1 and 3.  
Registration to FuSEC is available at its online registration form . Any e-mail about FuSEC 2015 event must be sent exclusively to: info@future-security2015.de.

description.html:
Am Dienstag, den 18.08.2015 könnt Ihr Startups aus dem Gründungszentrum der HWR Berlin und der Gründerwerkstatt der BEUTH Berlin kennen lernen und selbst ein Teil der Produktentwicklung werden.


Im Rahmen des Events könnt Ihr Erfahrungen sammeln, neues Wissen generieren, außergewöhnliche Gründerpersönlichkeiten und externe Teilnehmer kennen lernen.

 

Für euer Engagement sorgen wir für euer leibliches Wohl. Wir stellen leckere Pizza und Getränke bereit. Aus Erfahrung können wir berichten, dass niemand hungrig nach Hause gehen wird. :)


Folgende Teams geben Einblicke in Ihre Produkte:

  • Founderio(ehemals Mitgründer.com)  - Gründungszentrum der HWR Berlin
  • Skill Hero - Gründungszentrum der HWR Berlin
  • Kullo - Secure Communication - (Gründerwerkstatt der Beuth Hochschule)

 

Melde dich jetzt an und erhalte Dein persönliches Ticket!

  

Wir freuen uns auf Dich!


 

 

Weitere Informationen zum Ablauf:

ab 11.30 Uhr 

  • Ankunft der Gäste / kleine Vorstellungsrunde Gründer-Teams

 

ab 12.00 Uhr

 

  • Kennenlernen der Produktneuheiten
  • Aktives Testen der Produkte durch die Teilnehmer (je 15 min)
  • Nicht testende Gäste können trinken, snacken, netzwerken

 

 

ab 12.30 Uhr

  • Eintreffen der Pizza und entspanntes, gemeinsames Mittagessen

 

12.30 - 14.00 Uhr

 

  • zusätzlicher Testzeitraum für Nachzügler
  • Erfahrungs- und Wissensaustausch, Netzwerken
  • Feedbackrunde

description.html:
NACHSPIEL | Carl Nielsen und Brahms' Klavier-Trios mit dem Gewinner des Kammermusikpreises 2014 des Dänischen Rundfunks

Trio Vitruvi
Niklas Walentin, Violine
Jacob la Cour, Violoncello
Alexander McKenzie, Klavier


» Carl Nielsen: Klaviertrio G-Dur (1883)
» Carl Nielsen: Drei Stücke für Klavier op. 59 (1928)
» Johannes Brahms: Klaviertrio Nr.1 H-Dur op. 8 (1889)


Die Klaviertrios des nur 18-jährigen Carl Nielsen und des 21-jährigen Johannes Brahms bilden den Rahmen für die experimentelle, späte Klaviermusik von Nielsen. Gespielt werden sie von einem neuen Kammermusikensemble aus Dänemark, das 2014 den Kammermusikpreis des dänischen Rundfunks gewann und damit den Durchbruch schaffte.
An der Violine ist Dänemarks größtes Violinen-Talent Niklas
Walentin zu bewundern, der hier mit dem Australier Alexander McKenzie und dem Dänen Jacob la Cour zusammenspielt.

Trio Vitruvi Niklas Walentin, Violine Jacob la Cour, Violoncello Alexander McKenzie, Klavier 
 » Carl Nielsen: Klaviertrio G-Dur (1883) » Carl Nielsen: Drei Stücke für Klavier op. 59 (1928) » Johannes Brahms: Klaviertrio Nr.1 H-Dur op. 8 (1889) 
  
Die Klaviertrios des nur 18-jährigen Carl Nielsen und des 21-jährigen Johannes Brahms bilden den Rahmen für die experimentelle, späte Klaviermusik von Nielsen. Gespielt werden sie von einem neuen Kammermusikensemble aus Dänemark, das 2014 den Kammermusikpreis des dänischen Rundfunks gewann und damit den Durchbruch schaffte. An der Violine ist Dänemarks größtes Violinen-Talent Niklas Walentin zu bewundern, der hier mit dem Australier Alexander McKenzie und dem Dänen Jacob la Cour zusammenspielt.

description.html:
Flink Forward: The First International 2 Day Open Source Conference around Apache Flink.


Flink Forward 2015 is the first conference to bring together the Apache Flink developer and user community.

 

Apache Flink is a programming environment and distributed runtime that makes it easy for developers to build batch and streaming data applications. Flink offers familiar fluent programming APIs and a set of libraries, and backs these APIs with a robust and hybrid execution engine that unifies stream and batch processing. Flink entered the Apache Incubator in April 2014, and graduated in December 2014. 


Flink Forward 2015 will take place at the Kulturbrauerei in Prenzlauer Berg, Berlin. Join the talks and workshops at the Kesselhaus and Maschinenhaus and meet the other attendees at the Palais.

 

Tickets include:

 

  • 2 Days of Talks and Workshops
  • All On-site Networking Events
  • Monday Evening Dinner
  • Monday Night Flink Fest
  • Meals During Flink Forward

For more info see: www.flink-forward.org

description.html:
GET DOWN, GET DIRTY - GROW YOUR OWN FOOD COURSE
Get Down, Get Dirty is an year long course, the high-light of the City-plot - Agora Collaboration. 
In this year long course you will learn and get one to one consultancy to start your own permaculture vegetable garden.

GDGD is an in-depth six-part series of half-day workshops covers the fundamentals of sustainable organic growing as the seasons unfold. We will cover crop planning, seeds, seedlings, composting, soil health, propagation by cuttings, creating a balanced garden, various vegetables, herbs, fruit, wild and edible flower crops, seed saving, four-season growing, harvest and more. We have separate groups for beginning and intermediate growers. We will combine theory with hands-on practical work!

 

Content:

march

1: Planning an Edible Natural Garden     
1:1 Creating a Balanced Ecosystem    
1:2 Where to Grow    
1:3 Sun, Moon, Temperature and Climate    
1:4 General Crop Characteristics    
1:5 Making a Plan    
1:6 Homework    

april
2: Getting Dirty    
2:1 How to start growing indoors    
2:2 What to plant when    
2:3 Planting the Seeds    
2:4 Caring for your Seedlings    
2:5 Transplanting seedlings  

may
3: Building Healthy Soil
3:1 Building Healthy Soil    
3:2 Building Healthy Soil – Composting    
3:3 Homework    

june 
4: Caring for your crops    
4:1 General Crop Care    
4:2 Family by Family, Crop by Crop    
4:3 Attracting Beneficial Insects    
4:4 Pests and Diseases    43:5 Propagating by cuttings
    
august
5: Extending the Season and Seed Saving
5:2 Seed Saving    
5:3 Winter Crops    
5:4 Structures to Extend the Growing Season    
5:5 Building Healthy Soil: Green Manures, Leafmould, Crop Rotation and Nutrients    

september
6: harvesting, processing and storage
6:1 Vegetable, Fruit and Herb Storage    
7: Resources

We're going on tour! Join us in one of nine cities across the globe for a crash course on integrating 3D motion control and interaction design into VR, desktop, and beyond. 


These essential building blocks will prime you for participation in our global 3D Jam. We're giving away over $50k in cash and prizes. Don't miss out. 


Register Here

There will be two workshops:

1) 2pm - 3:30pm
2) 5pm - 6:30pm


Bringing Your Actual Hands into VR with Leap Motion
Leap Motion's Martin Schubert and Peter Ehirlich will dig into the nuts and bolts of bringing dynamic 3D motion control into your VR project.

While Martin will focus on emerging desing and development principles in Unity, Peter will explore the bleeding-edge of building the 3D web.


What to bring to the workshop:

- Your laptop

- Your HMD (Head Mounted Display)
   * Please note if you wanted to attend the workshop but don't have HMD. Still sign up there will limited loaners available.

- Your charger

- Your imagination 
 
 

FAQs:

Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?

Any questions email developers@leapmotion.com.


Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?

This event is all ages and skill levels welcome.

description.html:
11th European Speechwriter Network Conference in Berlin


This conference is for people who write speeches for top people in their organisations.

You’ll meet colleagues who face the same challenges. 

The European Speechwriter Network has pioneered a format where we listen to top speechwriters, leaders and interpreters talk about their work.

We learn what techniques they use, how they craft stories, how they build relationships.


Who should attend?

Previous conferences in the Brussels, Amsterdam and London have attracted speechwriters from the European Commission, NATO, IBM, the CBI, Orange, Deloitte, the United Nations, the European Investment Bank, Coca Cola as well as the Dutch, Danish and British civil service.

This conference is for anyone wanting to improve their ability to write and deliver speeches.

While the conference is predominantly in English, the techniques will be transferable to other languages.

It's also for people wishing to improve their company's ability to communicate ideas.

You should attend this course if you are interested in:
 

  • Communicating your organisation's mission, vision and values
     
  • Helping leaders motivate and inspire
     
  • Discovering techniques to give your speeches more impact
     
  • Understanding how speeches are interpreted
     
  • Engaging people with your ideas
     


The benefits
 

  • Acquire techniques used in the White House, European institutions and in numerous government and multinational offices around Europe.
     
  • Get insights into rhetoric from top writers
     
  • Listen to outstanding public speakers
     
  • Have your own work analysed in interactive sessions with top trainers
     
  • Meet fellow professionals from the Europe and the rest of the world

 

Programme

DAY 1

Thursday 22 October

Delegates can choose from three pre-conference training workshops

10am - 4.30pm followed by drinks/networking reception.


The workshops will run with a minimum of six delegates and a maximum of 14. If any workshop doesn’t have a quorum, you will be offered an alternative workshop.


1)Heroic Speechwriting with Jay Heinrichs. Click here for a detailed programme.
 

2)Nuts & Bolts of Speechwriting with Martha Leyton and Martin Shovel. Click here for a detailed programme.


3)Principles of Multicultural Speechmaking with Alexander von Reumont. Click here for a detailed programme.


4)Visual Communication for Business with Alexei Kapterev. Click here for a detailed programme.
 

Post-workshop meal

We will be in the restaurant UMSPANNWERK OST, Palisadenstraße 48, 10243 Berlin (delegates pay for their own meal)

DAY 2

Friday 23 October

Click for Full Conference programme

10am - 4.30pm - European Speechwriter Network Conference, followed by drinks


Speakers include: Hans Kristian Amundsen, David Krikler, Marina Lacroix, Suzanne Levy, Brent Kerrigan, Nicholas Wyke, Jay Heinrichs ..and more to be announced soon

 

What you will learn and leave with
 

  • A better understanding of what makes an effective speech
     
  • Insights on how to work with multilingual audiences
     
  • Tips for managing your speakers
     
  • Strategies for dealing with interpreters
     
  • New contacts, ideas and perspectives on the trade

 

 

Pre-Conference Trainers

Jay Heinrichs

One of the world’s leading persuasion consultants, Jay Heinrichs is the author of the bestselling Thank You for Arguing: What Aristotle, Lincoln, and Homer Simpson Can Teach Us About the Art of Persuasion. Now in its second edition, the book has been published in seven languages. He has served as a content and persuasion consultant for Mindshare, Ogilvy UK, Southwest Airlines, Walmart, Wells Fargo, Bass Hotels, Harvard University, and many others.

In addition, Jay has served as a speechwriter for American conservation leaders, an ambassador, and several business leaders. He has given speeches and presentations himself in front of a wide range of corporate, nonprofit, and academic audiences.

He is @jayheinrichs on Twitter, and you can follow him on Facebook and YouTube. You can also contact him on his website, jayheinrichs.com.

 


Martin Shovel & Martha Leyton

Martha Leyton and Martin Shovel run UK consultancy CreativityWorks.

They write speeches for chief executives, politicians, leaders of trade unions and professional organizations, and they train speechwriters and other communications professionals.

Martin was recently commissioned to write a series on political rhetoric for the Guardian’s Mind Your Language blog, and is currently writing a book on rhetoric.

He is also a prolific cartoonist and commentator on Twitter, and he and Martha have created several animated films, including the viral YouTube hit, ‘Busting the Mehrabian Myth’. Martha and Martin will be running their popular workshop, ‘The Nuts and Bolts of Speechwriting’.

 

 

Alexei Kapterev

A teacher of visual communication at the Graduate School of Business Administration at Moscow State University, Alexei came to fame with his presentation, Death by PowerPoint - a presentation on presentations.

He works with Mercator, Russia's premier studio producing corporate presentations. He is the author of the book Presentation Secrets published by John Wiley.

 


Alexander von Reumont

Alexander von Reumont (MSc) is a Public Speaking consultant based in Berlin Germany. He studied Acting and Directing in Munich, Los Angeles and Johannesburg and holds a Master Degree of Science in Educational Psychology from New York State University with a focus on Change Leadership.

He worked in theatre, film and radio for many years before he turned into teaching and consulting. He taught at WITS University in Johannesburg and UCT in Capetown. He is visiting lecturer at numerous Universities in his native country Germany such as the Berlin Centre for Higher Education or the Bauhaus University in Weimar.

He conducts seminars in companies and organizations and gives presentations on international conferences.

 


Speakers

 

Hans Kristian Amundsen

Hans was Jens Stoltenberg's speechwriter when Norway came under terrorist attack on 22 July 2011. He was formerly the editor-in-chief of Nordlys, a Norwegian newspaper.

 

 

 

David Krikler

David is a director at Aperture Communications. He spent several years at the Israeli Embassy in London, as the chief communications adviser to Ambassador Ron Prosor, providing round the clock counsel during a number of high-profile international incidents and gaining valuable experience of crisis communications and international affairs.

 

 

Marina Lacroix

Marina studied political theory at the University of Amsterdam, as well as classical guitar at the Conservatory of Amsterdam.

After writing speeches for the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs and doing some scattered work for politicians and NGOs, she moved to Brussels where she worked for the European Commission, writing speeches and advising on external communications.

Marina is currently a Communications Specialist at McKinsey & Company, where preparing speeches and presentations for colleagues and clients remains one of her responsibilities. She’s no longer doing any musical stage performances, but is proud to say her work has been incorporated in the corpus of a touring speech karaoke, run by the Finish Speech Karaoke Action Group.

 

Suzanne Levy

Suzanne is Senior Speechwriter for the Minister (Jet Bussemaker) at the Dutch Department of Education, Science and Culture. In this position she served several ministers and secretaries of state. Last year, she was seconded to the mayor of Amsterdam, Eberhard van der Laan, for several months.


Suzanne has been playing the violin since her childhood and was co-founder of the all-female klezmer orchestra “The Kalles”. She studied music at the Hilversum Conservatory and received a Master’s degree in Musicology from the University of Amsterdam. She thereafter followed a post-doctorate course in journalism and several courses in speechwriting.

In 2014, Suzanne won the Cicero Award in the category ‘Diversity’ with the speech The Face of Intolerance (Nr 21)

 

Jacqueline Schäfer

Jacqueline started her career as a journalist on a newspaper in Passau. She became an editor on Die Welt before she was appointed as one of the Parliamentary correspondents for Deutsche Welle TV - first in Bonn, later in Berlin.

Her first job as a speechwriter was writing for a trade association of the pharmaceutical industry. Jacqueline now works as a speechwriter, speaker and media coach in German business and politics. She is the media spokesperson for the German Speechwriters' Guild. 

Jacqueline will be speaking about how to manage the relationship between speaker and speechwriter.

 


Brent Kerrigan

Brent Kerrigan is the founder of Global Speechwriter, a company specialising in executive-level speechwriting and online speechwriting training. 
 
Brent’s clients have included the most senior members of the Government of Canada, the United Nations, and numerous private businesses.
 


Nicholas Wyke

Nicholas works in Brussels, in the Communications team at EUROCONTROL, an intergovernmental organisation with 41 member states and is concerned with European Air Traffic Management. As well as dealing with the press and running Twitter, he writes speeches for the Director General. However, his background in in numbers, not words, with a career mostly in finance after a Cambridge degree in mathematics.

 

 

Claudius Kroker

Claudius is a journalist and professional speechwriter. He’s been running his own public relations business since 2002. Prior to this he worked at newspapers, news agencies, and radio news services, as a press relations officer, and finally as the managing editor of a PR agency in Bonn.

He supports public relations activities of industrial and commercial enterprises, associations, universities, and other public and private entities. From 2008 to 2014, he was spokesman of the Association of German-Language Speechwriters (Verband der Redenschreiber deutscher Sprache).

 

 

Jay Heinrichs

Jay's conference talk will be titled: You’ll Never Take Our Freedom! How Hollywood changed speechwriting (and why that matters to you and me). Every speechwriter knows that Hollywood cheats. It brings in music to build drama and emotion, cuts to close-ups of teary audiences and uses dramatic backdrops. Yet, just as Hollywood has influenced culture around the world, it has also changed what audiences expect from a speech. Persuasion expert and author Jay Heinrichs will show how to use Hollywood-style techniques, even in the least dramatic kinds of speechwriting.

Using clips of the best movie speeches, he’ll leave you laughing, enlightened…and inspired. One of the world’s leading experts on persuasion, Jay Heinrichs is the author of the bestselling Thank You for Arguing: What Aristotle, Lincoln, and Homer Simpson Can Teach Us About the Art of Persuasion.


We do our best to make sure all speakers appear as billed, but we may have to make some substitutions in the event of illness or unexpected events.

More speakers will be announced soon...
 

Click here to see the video of the Amsterdam conference in October 2014
 

Invoices
 

If you prefer to submit a purchase order or you would like us to send you an invoice instead of paying through Eventbrite, please get in touch.


The final prices will include German sales tax @ 19%.

 

Cancellation Policy

 

Bookings will not be accepted unless accompanied by payment and cancellations must be received no later than one month (28 days) before the conference if a full refund is to be given.

 

Cancellations received within 2 to 4 weeks of the first date of conference will be refunded 50%. No refunds will be given for cancellations made within 14 days.


Local Hotels


If you want to stay next to the conference venue we recommend you book @ €128 per night:


NH Berlin Alexanderplatz

Landsberger Allee 26-32

D-10249 Berlin

Tel.+49 30 4226130

e-mail: nhberlinalexanderplatz@nh-hotels.com


 

If you want somewhere inexpensive and quirky, which is about 25 minutes from the venue on the Untergrundbahn, we recommend:


Hotel Pension Nürnberger Eck
Nürnberger Strasse 24A
10789 Berlin
Tel + 49 30 235 17 80
e-mail: nuernberger-eck@t-online.de

 

Students


There are a limited number of places available at a discount to people in full-time education who are considering a career in speechwriting. Details on application.


Testimonials


Click here to read an article the Financial Times wrote about one of our conferences.

It was a great event and I found the speakers provided an excellent insight into the world of speechwriting - so thank you!

Kate, IBM


We went back to the real nitty-gritty elements of the craft, and going back to basics made me think afresh about different approaches that can be taken. The Conference overall was educational, practical and full of ideas and creative energy. Attending was a brilliant opportunity – go!

Jonathan Kinsella (speechwriter at Dept of Culture, Media and Sport)


Loved the conference. Great speakers and well organized. Learnt lots.

Alistair McIntosh, Chief Executive, Housing Quality Network


Thanks especially for getting Sam Leith and David Day to speak to the group, both were utterly compelling.  And thanks for all the thought and hard work that doubtlessly go into this event every year, I can't think of any other conference that's worth packing a suitcase for.

Maddy, Clifford Chance

It was a hugely enjoyable two days and an honour to speak among such stellar names. Congrats on pulling off such a successful event.

David K

I greatly enjoyed the conference, and very much appreciated being invited.

Edward Mortimer, former speechwriter to Kofi Annan
 

Let me thank you wholeheartedly again for having invited me to your brilliantly organized conference in Oxford. I enjoyed it thoroughly and I was impressed by the line-up of speakers, the truly international mix of people, the intellectual level of the contributions (and contributors) and the wonderful venue you had chosen

Willi Vogler, Verband der Redenschreiber deutscher Sprache


Thanks for organising such a brilliant event – I have just been raving about how brilliant the event was to my colleagues and would very much like one of them to attend next year, could you keep me on your mailing list.

Communications Director at Astellas Pharma Europe


Thanks for organising such a great event.

Ben Duncan, Senior Adviser to the Director, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control


Thank you for an outstanding conference. Congratulations for organising multiple perspectives on speech writing – Foreign Office, UN, government and business.

Jamie Priestley
description.text:
11th European Speechwriter Network Conference in Berlin   
 
  
This conference is for people who write speeches for top people in their organisations. 
You’ll meet colleagues who face the same challenges.  
The European Speechwriter Network has pioneered a format where we listen to top speechwriters, leaders and interpreters talk about their work. 
We learn what techniques they use, how they craft stories, how they build relationships. 
 Who should attend? 
Previous conferences in the Brussels, Amsterdam and London have attracted speechwriters from the European Commission, NATO, IBM, the CBI, Orange, Deloitte, the United Nations, the European Investment Bank, Coca Cola as well as the Dutch, Danish and British civil service. 
This conference is for anyone wanting to improve their ability to write and deliver speeches.  
While the conference is predominantly in English, the techniques will be transferable to other languages. 
It's also for people wishing to improve their company's ability to communicate ideas.  
You should attend this course if you are interested in:   

Communicating your organisation's mission, vision and values  
Helping leaders motivate and inspire  
Discovering techniques to give your speeches more impact  
Understanding how speeches are interpreted  
Engaging people with your ideas  

 The benefits   

Acquire techniques used in the White House, European institutions and in numerous government and multinational offices around Europe.  
Get insights into rhetoric from top writers  
Listen to outstanding public speakers  
Have your own work analysed in interactive sessions with top trainers  
Meet fellow professionals from the Europe and the rest of the world

 
 
 



Programme



DAY 1  
Thursday 22 October 
Delegates can choose from three pre-conference training workshops 
10am - 4.30pm followed by drinks/networking reception. 
 The workshops will run with a minimum of six delegates and a maximum of 14. If any workshop doesn’t have a quorum, you will be offered an alternative workshop. 
 1)Heroic Speechwriting with Jay Heinrichs. Click here for a detailed programme.   
2)Nuts & Bolts of Speechwriting with Martha Leyton and Martin Shovel. Click here for a detailed programme. 
  
3)Principles of Multicultural Speechmaking with Alexander von Reumont. Click here for a detailed programme. 
  
4)Visual Communication for Business with Alexei Kapterev. Click here for a detailed programme.   
Post-workshop meal  
We will be in the restaurant UMSPANNWERK OST, Palisadenstraße 48, 10243 Berlin (delegates pay for their own meal) 




DAY 2  
Friday 23 October 
Click for Full Conference programme 
10am - 4.30pm - European Speechwriter Network Conference, followed by drinks 
 Speakers include: Hans Kristian Amundsen, David Krikler, Marina Lacroix, Suzanne Levy, Brent Kerrigan, Nicholas Wyke, Jay Heinrichs ..and more to be announced soon 




  
What you will learn and leave with   

A better understanding of what makes an effective speech  
Insights on how to work with multilingual audiences  
Tips for managing your speakers  
Strategies for dealing with interpreters  
New contacts, ideas and perspectives on the trade

  
  
Pre-Conference Trainers   
 
Jay Heinrichs 
One of the world’s leading persuasion consultants, Jay Heinrichs is the author of the bestselling Thank You for Arguing: What Aristotle, Lincoln, and Homer Simpson Can Teach Us About the Art of Persuasion. Now in its second edition, the book has been published in seven languages. He has served as a content and persuasion consultant for Mindshare, Ogilvy UK, Southwest Airlines, Walmart, Wells Fargo, Bass Hotels, Harvard University, and many others. 
In addition, Jay has served as a speechwriter for American conservation leaders, an ambassador, and several business leaders. He has given speeches and presentations himself in front of a wide range of corporate, nonprofit, and academic audiences. 
He is @jayheinrichs on Twitter, and you can follow him on Facebook and YouTube. You can also contact him on his website, jayheinrichs.com. 
  

 Martin Shovel & Martha Leyton 
 
Martha Leyton and Martin Shovel run UK consultancy CreativityWorks.  
They write speeches for chief executives, politicians, leaders of trade unions and professional organizations, and they train speechwriters and other communications professionals.  
Martin was recently commissioned to write a series on political rhetoric for the Guardian’s Mind Your Language blog, and is currently writing a book on rhetoric.  
He is also a prolific cartoonist and commentator on Twitter, and he and Martha have created several animated films, including the viral YouTube hit, ‘Busting the Mehrabian Myth’. Martha and Martin will be running their popular workshop, ‘The Nuts and Bolts of Speechwriting’. 
  

  
 
Alexei Kapterev 
A teacher of visual communication at the Graduate School of Business Administration at Moscow State University, Alexei came to fame with his presentation, Death by PowerPoint - a presentation on presentations. 
He works with Mercator, Russia's premier studio producing corporate presentations. He is the author of the book Presentation Secrets published by John Wiley. 
  

  
 
Alexander von Reumont 
Alexander von Reumont (MSc) is a Public Speaking consultant based in Berlin Germany. He studied Acting and Directing in Munich, Los Angeles and Johannesburg and holds a Master Degree of Science in Educational Psychology from New York State University with a focus on Change Leadership. 
He worked in theatre, film and radio for many years before he turned into teaching and consulting. He taught at WITS University in Johannesburg and UCT in Capetown. He is visiting lecturer at numerous Universities in his native country Germany such as the Berlin Centre for Higher Education or the Bauhaus University in Weimar. 
He conducts seminars in companies and organizations and gives presentations on international conferences. 
  

  
Speakers 
  
 
Hans Kristian Amundsen 
Hans was Jens Stoltenberg's speechwriter when Norway came under terrorist attack on 22 July 2011. He was formerly the editor-in-chief of Nordlys, a Norwegian newspaper. 
  
  

  
 
David Krikler 
David is a director at Aperture Communications. He spent several years at the Israeli Embassy in London, as the chief communications adviser to Ambassador Ron Prosor, providing round the clock counsel during a number of high-profile international incidents and gaining valuable experience of crisis communications and international affairs.

Cloud Security Alliance's 4th annual European conference.  

Once again CSA Congress EMEA will attract a unique mix of thoughts leaders, policy and decision makers representing the key industry players, cloud customers, (private and public buyers, global enterprise and SMEs) and the R&D community.

This event is expected to draw 250-300 attendees and is organized in support with Fraunhofer-FOKUS, one of the most relevant organizations in Technology Innovation in Europe.

 Learn more about the conference at the event website at https://csacongress.org/event/emea-2015/

description.html:
Dreamers and Doers is a high-impact community of trailblazing women. Our community consists of a diverse group of female founders, aspiring entrepreneurs, individuals who work at startups and various other types of female creators and change makers.

—

What we all have in common is a burning desire to create and make a dent in this universe. We share the belief that so much more is possible if we join forces on our journeys.

—

Please join us for an unofficial Dreamers and Doers gathering in Berlin, Thursday, August 13th! Meeting to connect with an awesome group of like-minded women.

description.html:
Raspberry Jam Berlin!

Raspberry Pi  is a formidable, credit-card sized computer that plugs into your TV and a keyboard. It’s a capable little PC which can be used for many of the things that your desktop PC does, like spreadsheets, word-processing and games. It also plays high-definition video.

Raspberry Jam is a rapidly growing global network of user groups that meet every month to support hobbyists, developers, teachers, students, children and families – in fact, anybody that would like to put their Raspberry Pi to good use. While Raspberry Jam is not endorsed, sponsored or associated with Raspberry Pi or Raspberry Pi products or services, some of our regular members are volunteers for the Raspberry Pi Foundation. At our meetings we have helpful people who can help you with everything you need to get what you want from your Raspberry Pi.

description.html:
Freitag/Friday 14. August 2015     

AMISTAT
Singer / Songwriter

Support Act: Sam Brittain
Singer / Songwriter

Einlass/admission: 20:30 Uhr / 8:30 pm
Beginn / start: 21:00 Uhr / 9:00 pm
VVK / Presale 10.- € - abends / at the door: 12,- €

AMISTAT
Jan und Josef, die gemeinsam die Band AMISTAT bilden, sind Zwillinge, geboren und aufgewachsen in Rosenheim. Früh haben die beiden ihre Leidenschaft für Musik entdeckt und beschlossen irgendwann einmal von der Musik zu leben. Vor 3 Jahren sind sie nach Australien gezogen, um dort ihre Musikkarriere zu starten. Nach zwei veröffentlichten Alben und der ersten “headline national tour” durch Australien Anfang diesen Jahres, beschlossen die Brüder nun ihr Debut in Europa zu geben. Sie treten beim berühmten Madness Festival in Holland auf, reisen mit ihrer Musik, durch England, Schottland und nach Berlin, dabei sammeln sie Inspirationen für ihr neues Album, das Ende diesen Jahres in Melbourne aufgenommen wird. Als Support Act haben die beiden Sam Brittain, einen ihrer besten Freunde aus Adelaide (Süd-Australien) mit dabei. Amistat lädt zu einaem Abend mit Folk Musik und Reisegeschichten ein und wir können mehr über ihre Ambitionen erfahren.

Josef und Jan Prasil .......Gitarre, Piano und Gesang
Sam Brittain ................. Gitarre und Gesang
---
Josef and Jan Prasil, twin brothers who together form AMISTAT are easily recognizable for their acoustic set heard on the streets of Melbourne. Originally from Europe, the brothers reunited in 2013 to rekindle their music.
Borne of the intimacy only twins share, their unadorned sound produces unique harmonies.
Inspired by a life on the road, Jan and Josef’s kinship is emphasized through their lyrics, in which these young musicians infuse their sentiment, hopes and ambitions.
Highlighting their individuality, the brothers bring together their contrasting musical styles and personalities to create a balanced sound.
Having recently launched their highly anticipated second EP " Somewhere Sometime " at the Kelvin Club, (Melbourne) AMISTAT are about to kick of their upcoming National EP Tour in May and June.
Whoever has experienced AMISTAT and their wonderful sound live on stage or busking on Bourke Street Mall is oddly touched by the emotional investment in their music.

AMISTAT:
http://www.facebook.com/amistatmusic
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kd_TCvBH3ks
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JZfDXb4-f00
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e5KXBrvID-Q

Sam Brittain:
http://www.facebook.com/sambrittainofficial
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q73E_HrpWTo
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K0DQa5E8i9k
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xes7zqsqUgs

description.html: Authentic Pilates Convention is the first ever conference in Germany for authentic Pilates. Hosted by Alice R. Talkington, the event features some of the biggest names in Pilates: Alycea Ungaro, Brett Howard, Clare Dunphy, and Moses Urbano. Taking place at Berlin's Swissôtel right in the heart of Kurfürstendamm, the location offers you first class dining and shopping opportunities. Unsurpassable line-up, fantastic space, and an amazing opportunity to experience Joseph Pilates' original method on authentic apparatus. Visit www.authenticpilatesconvention.com for details and be sure to sign up for the newsletter!

description.html:
Food-Unternehmer und Gastro-Start-Up Gründer aufgepasst!

Am 9. und 10. September geht mit den GASTRO STARTUP SESSIONS ein neues Event-Format an den Start:

Zwei Tage lang treffen sich im Herzen von Berlin Brancheninsider und Experten mit Gastro-Gründern zum Wissensaustausch. Die Teilnehmer dürfen sich auf Vorträge zu Themen wie Startup-Finanzierung, Marketing & PR, Social Business und Innovative Geschäftsmodelle mit jeder Menge praktischer Tipps und interessanter Denkanstöße freuen! Obendrein haben wir den Food Entrepreneurs Club mit einem Panel zum Thema „How to Start a Food Business“ zu Gast. Gastro-Gründer erzählen uns von ihren Erfahrungen auf dem Weg in die die Selbstständigkeit. Abends schauen wir uns bei einer Tour Berlins spannende und innovative Gastro-Konzepte an!

 

THEMEN

FINANZIERUNG

BRAUEREI-SPONSORING

MARKETING UND PR

SOCIAL BUSINESS

INNOVATIVE GESCHÄFTSMODELLE

HOW TO START A FOOD BUSINESS

BUCHHALTUNG & PERSONAL

 

DIE MACHER VON

PRINCESS CHEESECAKE

MAKRÖNCHEN MANUFAKTUR

GORILLAZ BBQ

BURGERS & HIP HOP

VIVA CON AQUA

LEMONAID

FOOD ENTREPRENEURS CLUB

NOMY BLOG

FLUTLOTSEN


Die GASTRO STARTUP SESSIONS werden vom Gastronomie Netzwerk Leaders Club Deutschland veranstaltet. Mehr Infos gibt’s hier: http://www.leadersclub.de

We are excited to announce the first ever GF Team European Summer Camp hosted by none less than GF Team Cead Coach and 6th degree coral belt Master Julio Cesar, together with GF Team Berlin coach Gabriel Rainho! 

Master Julio Cesar is one of the most respected BJJ instructors and is also the founding member and main instructor of GF Team. He has developed BJJ champions such as Rodolfo Vieira, Vitor Henrique, Ricardo Evangelista, Igor Silva and many others.
We are pleased that he is hosting the first ever GF Team Summer Camp in Europe, an event that’s not to be missed!

The event will take place in Berlin and is open to everyone regardless of team, age, gender or belt / level. Further details below.

VENUE: TBC (most likely a venue near Rathaus Schöneberg, Berlin)

DATES: Mon, 24th August - Sat, 29th August 2015
TRAINING: Mon-Fri 7.00-8.30pm NoGi Grappling, 8.30-10.00pm BJJ. Sat: 10.00-11.30am NoGi Grappling, 11.30-1.00pm BJJ 

PRICING:
20,- € single Class
35,- € both classes
100,- € BJJ or NoGi all 6 days
160,- € all classes
Paypal-payment only; NO payment on the door. 


 
POSTS

description.html:
Networking-Abend und feierliche Verleihung der UX Design Awards 2015
In Kooperation mit der IFA - Consumer Electronics Berlin

Datum: Samstag, 5. September 2015 
Beginn: 19:00 Uhr (Einlass ab 18:00 Uhr)
Ort: orangelab, Ernst-Reuter-Platz 2, 10587 Berlin
Veranstaltungssprache: Deutsch 

Warteliste
Sollten alle Karten vergriffen sein, so wenden Sie sich bitte an
guests@ux-design-awards.com für einen Platz auf der Warteliste.
Eventmanagement: Daniela Gellner

UX Design Awards
Die UX Design Awards zeichnen herausragendes Design und Nutzerorientierung in Produkten, digitalen Lösungen und Services aus. Der Wettbewerb wird jährlich vom Internationalen Design Zentrum Berlin ausgerichtet. Alle nominierten Produkte werden in einer Sonderausstellung vom 4. bis zum 9. September auf der IFA Berlin präsentiert. 

Ausstellung der Nominierten
IFA Consumer Electronics Berlin
4. – 9. September, 10 – 18 Uhr
Halle 11.2 / Stand 113
www.ux-design-awards.com
www.ifa-berlin.de

 


Networking evening and UX Design Awards 2015 Ceremony
In cooperation with IFA - Consumer Electronics Berlin

Date: Saturday September 5, 2015
Opening: 7:00 pm (doors open 6:00 pm)
Venue: orangelab, Ernst-Reuter-Platz 2, 10587 Berlin
Language: German

Waiting List
If tickets are out of stock, please contact us to be placed on the waiting list: 
guests@ux-design-awards.com
Event management: Daniela Gellner

UX Design Awards
The UX Design Awards honour outstanding design and user orientation in products, digital solutions and services. The competition is presented annually by International Design Center Berlin (IDZ). All successfully nominated product solutions are presented to the general public at IFA, the global trade show for consumer and home electronics in Berlin.

Nominee Exhibition
IFA Consumer Electronics Berlin
September 4 – 9, 10 am – 6 pm
Hall 11.2/ Booth 113
www.ux-design-awards.com
www.ifa-berlin.de

description.html:
The fifth and final workshop in the Share-PSI series will address the topic of Maximising interoperability: core vocabularies, location-aware data and more. These are the questions and topics we would like to see addressed during presentations and workshop sessions. The list is not exhaustive but should give a clearer idea about the workshops aims:

  • How can existing vocabularies be used to provide semantic interoperability?
  • How can data publishers be supported in maximising the interoperability of their data sets within and across domains?
  • As location is often the common point between different datasets, how should location be represented?
  • How can public authorities support multilingualism?
  • How can the technical interoperability of datasets be maximised?
  • How can public authorities publish data that will be persistent, i.e. still be available after the particular project or department that created it has ceased to exist?

See full event description

description.html:
FIND OUT WHY THE ARAB MARKET IS A POTENTIAL MEGAMARKET FOR YOUR STARTUP

Why is the Middle East such a hot startup potato right now and why should you consider your market entry within the next 5 years?

Join us for this informal after work event to get insights about the entrepreneurial environment in the Middle East, learn about Carmudi's experience from entering the Gulf and how to deal with the business and legal frameworks when entering the region. Join us for this interesting talk to learn from local thought leaders and network with other startups/SMEs curious to expand to the Middle East.
 
WHO SHOULD ATTEND?
European based startup/SME curious to expand their business into the Middle East!

 

AGENDA SEPTEMBER 2ND 17:30-20:30

17:30 - 18:00 Registration & Networking

18:00 - 18:10 Welcome & introduction to doing business in GCC

18:10 - 18:30 The opportunities in the Arab world

18:30 - 18:45 Presentation on the entrepreneurial environment in the Middle East by Abdelhameed Sharara, CEO and founder of RiseUp

18:45 - 19:00 Presentation on the startup experience in the Middle East by Ali Izhar Ahmed, Head of Global Expansion at Carmudi (Rocket Internet)

19:00 - 19:15 Presentation on business and legal framework

19:15 - 19:45 Q&A Open session with presenters

19:45 - 20:30 Networking & drinks

 

SPEAKERS 
Market experts
Startup/SME


PARTNERS

                 


SUPPORTED BY

description.html:
The Midnight Run // European Tour 2015 // BERLIN, 15 August 2015

#MNRlight2015 // #MNRberlin

The Midnight Run is a walking, arts-filled, night-time cultural journey through a city. It gathers 35 strangers and 5 local artists/activists to explore, play and create whilst the city sleeps from 18:00 to 06:00! MADRID is the second capital city to host the European Tour of The Midnight Run 2015, coordinated by CCT-SeeCity and in partnership with UNESCO, to celebrate the International Year of Light (light2015.org).

50% of funds raised from event tickets will be donated to Liter of Light NGO, the goal being to provide low-cost solar lighting technology to a new centre for women and children called “The House of Marietou” and located in Pikine, a suburban village of Dakar, capital city of Senegal. Here, by the end of the UN’s International Year of Light, Liter of Light Italia will install 280 lights (both street and home lamps) thanks to the 280 MNRunners of The #MNRlight2015.

How to join The #MNRberlin? Sign up on Facebook/themnr and buy your ticket (30€) * on Eventbrite. NOTE: the event is open to only 35 participants, reserve your ticktes quickly!

- DRESS CODE: comfortable shoes + sweater/jacket for the night!

- MEETING POINT: Saturday 15 August 2015, 17.45 @ Kunstraum Kreuzberg/Bethanien (Mariannenplatz 2). At 18.00 we’ll leave, so it’s important to be punctual!

- INFO: www.themnr.com // www.cct-seecity.com

* For more information, Email: hello@cct-seecity.com // Tel or text: +39 366 9777735

- WATCH this 2-min VIDEO about The #MNRlight2015: https://vimeo.com/125821423

description.html:
Endlich eigener Chef werden

Selbstständig arbeiten, sein eigener Chef sein, angemessen verdienen: Nach wie vor gibt es viele gute Gründe, sich als Tierarzt / Tierärztin in eigener Praxis niederzulassen oder in eine bestehende Praxis einzusteigen. Damit Ihr Unternehmen richtig erfolgreich wird, gilt es Risiken und Chancen gründlich abzuwägen. Die Erfahrung zeigt: Je klarer die Zielvorstellung und je gründlicher die Vorbereitung, umso sicherer tritt der erhoffte Erfolg ein.

Fragen über Fragen

Es stellen sich nicht nur Fragen nach der medizinischen Ausrichtung und einer eventuellen Kooperationsform. Wesentliche Themen betreffen die Standortauswahl, die Analyse des Wettbewerbs, mögliche Spezialisierungen, Praxisausstattung aber auch finanzielle, steuerliche und rechtliche Aspekte. Die Bank verlangt einen plausiblen Businessplan für die Finanzierung.

Kompakt und entspannt

Machen Sie sich rechtzeitig fit für Ihr eigenes Unternehmen. Nutzen Sie dazu die langjährige Erfahrung unserer Experten, die bereits zahlreiche Tierärztinnen und Tierärzte erfolgreich in die Selbstständigkeit begleitet haben. In einem Kompaktseminar an einem entspannten Samstag Nachmittag erhalten Sie wertvolle Basics zu Ihrem Gründungsvorhaben.

Leistungen

Umfangreiche Informationen zur Praxisgründung, Tagungsunterlagen, Kaffee und Kuchen, Seminargetränke. Die Referenten stehen beim anschließenden Buffet für Einzelfragen bereit.

Ihre Investition

Den Teilnahmebeitrag von 80€* zzgl. MwSt. je Person überweisen oder zahlen Sie bitte vor Veranstaltungsbeginn. Der Betrag ist im Rahmen der Praxisgründung steuerlich absetzbar.

description.html:
Diese Klausur ist eine Kur für Körper und Geist. Sie dient dazu, sich voll der Meditation zu widmen.


Neben den Meditationssitzungen selbst werden in Vorträgen und Übungen konkrete Hilfestellungen zur spirituellen Praxis gegeben und Fragen zum persönlichen Prozess besprochen. Mit Ausnahme der Gruppen- und Einzelarbeit mit Torsten wird während der Klausur geschwiegen.


Diese Klausur ist sowohl für Anfänger, als auch für Fortgeschrittene geeignet, und setzt keine Religionszugehörigkeit voraus.


Alle Teile des Klausurprogramms sind wahlweise, das heißt, es ist möglich, nur an bestimmten Programm-Punkten, oder auch nur an bestimmten Tagen teilzunehmen.

 

Unterkunft und Verpflegung

Die Übernachtung vor Ort wird empfohlen, aber nicht vorausgesetzt. Hierfür stehen 2- und 3-Bettzimmer mit geteiltem WC und Duschbad zur Verfügung.

Die Verpflegung (Frühstück und Mittagessen) stellt das Buddhistische Haus. Zwischen Mittagessen und Frühstück wird gefastet.

Weitere Fragen zu Unterkunft und Verpflegung beantwortet das Buddhistische Haus.


Kosten

Die Teilnahme am Klausurprogramm ist kostenlos. Für Unterkunft und Verpflegung erwartet das Buddhistische Haus gegebenenfalls eine Spende. Diese kann bei der Ankunft vor Ort entrichtet werden. Torsten Loesch leitet die Anmeldungen weiter, nimmt aber selber kein Geld entgegen.

 

Weitere Fragen und Antworten zur Klausur...



Vielen Dank an die Sponsoren von Torsten Loesch.

Neben den Meditationssitzungen selbst werden in Vorträgen und Übungen konkrete Hilfestellungen zur spirituellen Praxis gegeben und Fragen zum persönlichen Prozess besprochen. Mit Ausnahme der Gruppen- und Einzelarbeit mit Torsten wird während der Klausur geschwiegen. 
  
Diese Klausur ist sowohl für Anfänger, als auch für Fortgeschrittene geeignet, und setzt keine Religionszugehörigkeit voraus. 
  
Alle Teile des Klausurprogramms sind wahlweise, das heißt, es ist möglich, nur an bestimmten Programm-Punkten, oder auch nur an bestimmten Tagen teilzunehmen. 
  
Unterkunft und Verpflegung 
Die Übernachtung vor Ort wird empfohlen, aber nicht vorausgesetzt. Hierfür stehen 2- und 3-Bettzimmer mit geteiltem WC und Duschbad zur Verfügung. 
Die Verpflegung (Frühstück und Mittagessen) stellt das Buddhistische Haus. Zwischen Mittagessen und Frühstück wird gefastet. 
Weitere Fragen zu Unterkunft und Verpflegung beantwortet das Buddhistische Haus. 
  
Kosten 
Die Teilnahme am Klausurprogramm ist kostenlos. Für Unterkunft und Verpflegung erwartet das Buddhistische Haus gegebenenfalls eine Spende. Diese kann bei der Ankunft vor Ort entrichtet werden. Torsten Loesch leitet die Anmeldungen weiter, nimmt aber selber kein Geld entgegen. 
  
Weitere Fragen und Antworten zur Klausur... 
  
  
Vielen Dank an die Sponsoren von Torsten Loesch.

description.html:
The coffein hackathon (or caffeine hackathon) is a one-of-a-kind hackathon, organized by a small group of caffeine enthusiasts, namely the makers of Guaraná Brause, Meta Mate, and friends. In 2013, we organized the first coffein hackathon with talks by Jens Ohlig on Hackerbrause culture in the German Internet scene; by Fabricio do Canto on history and farming of Mate in South America; and by Gregor May who presented the Premium Kollektiv. In the food hacking session, Andy Weigt invented and cooked delicious treats with Mate, Guaraná, and other ingredients.

Let us once again come together to talk and hack. We are currently assembling a program and need your input: please send us an e-mail team@guarana-brause.de if you have an idea or suggestion, if you would like to give a talk or contribute in any other way.

Check out or main event website http://coffeinhackathon.com for more information.

description.html:
NACHSPIEL | Carl Nielsens volksmusikalische Wurzeln und das dänische Liedgut


Harald Haugaard Ensemble:
Harald Haugaard, Violine
Helene Blum, Gesang
Mikkel Grue, Gitarre
Kirstine Elise Pedersen, Violoncello
Sune Rahbek, Schlagzeug


Carl Nielsen war ein Freigeist, der durch alles inspiriert wurde,
was ihm auf seinem Weg begegnete. Besonders seine Kindheit auf der Insel Fynen war wesentliche Grundlage für sein Wirken. Die musikalischen Weisen und die Tanzmusik seiner Heimatregion
spielen eine markante Rolle in seinem kompositorischen Schaffen. Dies schlägt sich vor allem in seinen Volksliedern und Weisen
nieder, die ihm bei der breiten Bevölkerung den Durchbruch
verschafften und noch heute von jedem Dänen gesungen werden.

Der Violinist und Komponist Harald Haugaard setzt in seinem Konzert den Fokus auf Nielsens musikalische Wurzeln mit traditionellen Weisen von Nielsen selbst und seinen Zeitgenossen. Das Publikum wird mit einbezogen und Harald Haugaard moderiert
den Abend auf seine gewohnt unterhaltsame Art.
description.text:
NACHSPIEL | Carl Nielsens volksmusikalische Wurzeln und das dänische Liedgut 
 Harald Haugaard Ensemble: Harald Haugaard, Violine  Helene Blum, Gesang  Mikkel Grue, Gitarre  Kirstine Elise Pedersen, Violoncello  Sune Rahbek, Schlagzeug 
  
Carl Nielsen war ein Freigeist, der durch alles inspiriert wurde, was ihm auf seinem Weg begegnete. Besonders seine Kindheit auf der Insel Fynen war wesentliche Grundlage für sein Wirken. Die musikalischen Weisen und die Tanzmusik seiner Heimatregion spielen eine markante Rolle in seinem kompositorischen Schaffen. Dies schlägt sich vor allem in seinen Volksliedern und Weisen nieder, die ihm bei der breiten Bevölkerung den Durchbruch verschafften und noch heute von jedem Dänen gesungen werden. 
Der Violinist und Komponist Harald Haugaard setzt in seinem Konzert den Fokus auf Nielsens musikalische Wurzeln mit traditionellen Weisen von Nielsen selbst und seinen Zeitgenossen. Das Publikum wird mit einbezogen und Harald Haugaard moderiert den Abend auf seine gewohnt unterhaltsame Art.

description.html:
On Thursday, August 20, at 20:00, doors will open for the last Webfest Berlin Submissions Screening! For this evening of fantastic web series, we will see one episode from each of the following shows:

The Popcorn Show
Gas
Ghosts Of The Road
Zyara
The Outreach
Ex-Model
Tales From Tinder


There will be 7 GREAT SHOWS to watch on the big screen, FREE BEER, and FUN PEOPLE!

Screenings will start at 20:30 and run for about an hour.

Come out and find your favorite web series at the Webfest Berlin Submissions Screenings!

Webfest Berlin is a festival dedicated to encouraging and recognizing independent, international, web series and their creators. Webfest Berlin will show the world ‘What’s Next’ in global web series for the first time in September 2015. The celebration will feature 2 days of screenings, speakers, forums, and parties culminating in the announcement of the winners of the inaugural Webfest Berlin awards.

The digital space offers an opportunity for creators to tell their stories with complete creative freedom. Webfest Berlin seeks to share the work and the experiences of these trailblazing creators while building a strong network of independent storytellers; thus protecting, honoring, and fostering the web series in all it's forms.
We invite you take part in a movement that will determine the future of online entertainment. Join us at Webfest Berlin and 'Be What's Next'.


Submit your series at: webfest.berlin

-----------------

Am Donnerstag den 20. August 2015 öffnen sich ab 20:00 Uhr wieder die Türen für der letzte Webfest Berlin Submission Screening! An diesem Abend voller phantastischer Webserien werden wir jeweils eine Episode der folgenden Shows zeigen: 


The Popcorn Show
Gas
Ghosts Of The Road
Zyara
The Outreach
Ex-Model
Tales From Tinder


Es werden 7 GROSSARTIGE Episoden gezeigt, es gibt FREIBIER und jede Menge TOLLE LEUTE

Die Vorführung der Episoden beginnt um 20:30 Uhr und dauert etwa eine Stunde.

Kommt vorbei und findet Eure Lieblingswebserie beim Webfest Berlin Submission Screening!

Das Festival Webfest Berlin ist unabhängigen, internationalen Webserien und ihren kreativen Köpfen als Anerkennung gewidmet. Erstmalig im September 2015 will das Webfest Berlin der Welt zeigen „What´s Next“ in globalen Webserien. Das Festival findet an zwei Tagen hintereinander statt. Es gibt Filmvorführungen, Vorträge, Foren und Partys. Das Festival endet mit der Bekanntgabe der Gewinner der ersten Webfest Berlin Awards.

Die digitale Welt ermöglicht Kreativen ihre Storys ganz unabhängig und frei zu kreieren und zu verbreiten. Das Festival Webfest Berlin möchte die Arbeit sowie die Erfahrung dieser Menschen teilen, und sie mit der Bildung eines starken Netzwerks unabhängiger Künstler unterstützen. So können Webserien jeder Art auch zukünftig gefördert, geschützt und angemessen honoriert werden. Wir laden Euch ein! Werdet Teil einer Bewegung, die die Zukunft des Online Entertainments neu definiert. „Be What´s Next“!

Reicht Eure Webserien ein unter: webfest.berlin

description.html:
NACHSPIEL | Carl Nielsens Dänische Lieder


Denise Beck, Sopran
Thomas Storm, Bariton
Christine Raft, Klavier

Die dänische Romantik und Volkslied-Gesangstradition ist ein Teil des musikalischen Universums eines jeden Dänen. Gesungen wird überall: in Schulen, im Privaten und sogar bei offiziellen Treffen von Führungskräften. Und gerade jene Hunderte an Liedern, für die Carl Nielsen Melodien komponierte, gelten als Inbegriff des dänischen Klangs.

Carl Nielsen war einerseits nah an der europäischen Avantgarde und ließ sich von den damaligen bahnbrechenden Komponisten einnehmen. Anderseits schaffte er es, der größte Volkskomponist seiner Heimat zu sein – was zwei der größten dänischen Gesangstalente an diesem Abend eindrucksvoll zeigen.

August will be all about people & fashion, music & drinks, and the open sky! This meetup is a one-of-a-kind occasion to connect with other fashion professionals on the open air-terrace of co-working space RoofUp. 


YDL wants to facilitate the development of your network of fashion professionals and creatives in Berlin. This is an ideal setting to share your professional interests and see what kind of opportunities presents themselves to you. 

 

• Catch up with industry colleagues and meet & greet new people with new ideas and new skills!

• Get the opportunity to present your your ideas and see up and coming startups breaking through in the fashion scene!

 

Are you also interested in showing your products or banners at the event? 
Get a FREE spot! Email us and let us know what you woul dlike to present: info@youngdesignerslounge.com

YDL Designers Lounge 
Roof-Up Berlin

description.html:
NACHSPIEL | Carl Nielsens und Johannes Brahms’ Violinsonaten (2)


Niklas Walentin, Violine
Niklas Sivelöf, Klavier


» Carl Nielsen: Preludio e Presto für Solo-Violine, op. 52 (1928)
» Carl Nielsen: Sonate Nr. 1 A-Dur op. 9 (1895)
» Alexander Skrjabin: Sonate Nr. 4 Fis-Dur op. 30 (1903)
» Johannes Brahms: Sonate Nr. 2 A-Dur op. 100 (1886)

In diesem Programmteil wird Nielsens spätes, sehr originelles Werk für Solo-Violine aufgeführt, das von Bach inspiriert ist. Ein Werk von Nielsens zeitgenössischem russischen Kollegen Alexander Skrjabin ergänzt die Violinsonaten von Nielsen und Brahms. Der 20-jährige Niklas Walentin ist eines der größten dänischen Talente auf der Violine. Unterstützt wird er von dem schwedischen Pianisten Niklas Sivelöf, der leitender Klavierprofessor an der Königlichen Hochschule für Musik in Kopenhagen ist. Walentin hat gerade eine CD eingespielt, auf der u.a. die Nielsen-Werke seines Programmes zu hören sind.

description.html:
Get started with Kubernetes today! 


This hands on workshop will teach you everything you need to know about Kubernetes. You will learn about its various components, and how those components work together to form a single system to manage a cluster of Linux containers powered by Docker. After building a Kubernetes cluster from the ground up, attendees will deploy and manage a multi-tier web application using the Kubernetes API and the kubectl command line tool.

 

What you'll learn:
 

  • Kubernetes Core Concepts (pods, nodes, controllers, scheduling, and service discovery)

  • How to enable and manage key cluster add-ons such as DNS, monitoring, and the UI

  • How to configure nodes for the Kubernetes networking model (bare-metal and cloud)

  • Managing Applications with Kubernetes deployment patterns (rolling updates, canary deployments)


Light breakfast and lunch will be provided.


Brought to you by:







Canellation Policy: Since space is limited, the deadline to recieve a refund for an individual ticket is 2 weeks prior to the workshop.

description.html:
GeoMonday 2015.3 - A new dimension in Geo

 

One of the most discussed topic of the recent years is the rise of UAVs, MAVs, RPVs or simply drones. These flying devices are equipped in their latest evolutions not only with full HD cameras, but also GPS devices and even small computers. This equipment is the base for next generation aerial geo-data and services. In the 3rd edition of GeoMonday we will cover the whole lifecycle from the creation, processing up to the integration for location intelligence or services. It’s a special pleasure for us to have our session for the first time in the beautiful city center of Potsdam, thanks to our Partner Zukunftsagentur Brandenburg.


Get the latest announcement at http://blog.geomonday.org or follow our Twitter channel https://twitter.com/geomonday.


If you want to present your related products and/or service story, please contact us at info@geomonday.org and provide your headline and some background information.

Are you empowered to embrace change and create a new future for your business?

Explore the digital revolution and how it affects individuals, organisations, industries, and society in this mini-workshop. Learn collaborative methods of working through experiential learning, and tools to adapt and stay completive in today’s ever-changing world.

If you have any questions regarding this breakfast, please don't hesitate to email anna.vanderbrugghen@hyperisland.com.
 
Look forward to seeing you there!

description.html:
DJ / Producer Insight Masterclass with Red Rack'em (noisy Academy / Berlin / Djing)

A breakdown of the role of the DJ/Producer in todays dance music scene from Red Rack'em, who has toured internationally for the last 10 years and released singles and albums for well known labels including Sonar Kollektiv, Innervisions, N-SYDE, Wolf Music and Ramp Recordings. 

He has 20 years experience as an DJ and 10 years experience as a recording artist.
Take a closer look at how music production, DJ skills, podcasting and marketing are combined in todays role as a DJ/Producer and how to use these skills to create interest in your music.
Learn how to integrate several skill sets to multi-task and manage yourself as an DJ/Producer.
Enjoy a behind the scenes look at the reality of todays dance market and take part in a Q+A session at the end of the workshop.

description.html:
Samstagstraining der RMB!

 

Noch ist August, also wird das Training am Samstag dem 22.8.2105 nur draussen stattfinden, wenn das Wetter mitspielt. Themen dieses Trainings sollen "Innenstadt" und "Wohngebiet" (der VPs) sein.

Vorraussichtlich trainieren wir in Kreuzberg in der Nähe des Görli, der genaue Trainingsort wird aber erst in der Woche vom 17.8.2015 bekanntgegeben. Frühe Anmeldungen sind natürlich trotzdem gern gesehen!

Bitte beachtet: Für dieses Training werden 3-6 Helfer als VP (Versteckpersonen) gesucht, die am Besten in der Gegend wohnen! Richtig. Wir suchen Kreuzberger, die in der Gegend des Görli wohnen!



FAQs

 

Muss ich mich irgendwie ausweisen oder gibt es eine Altersbeschränkung für das Training?

Nein und nein. Wir freuen uns sogar über möglichst große Varianz bei unseren Helfern und heißen jeden Menschen, ob jung oder alt, neurodivers, körperbehindert oder eben genormt willkommen!

 

Wie komme ich zum Training und wie sieht es mit Parkplätzen aus?

Die Trainingsorte sind mit dem Auto sehr gut zu erreichen und das Parken ist in der Regel auch kein Problem. Wenn es nicht anders beschrieben wird im Ankündigungstext liegen die Orte immer ausserhalb von Parkzonen.

Was die Erreichbarkeit mit ÖPNV angeht, bemühen wir uns, sobald ein Helfer das möchte auch hier um möglichst große Nähe zu Bahn, Bus oder Tram. Bitte meldet Euch einfach rechtzeitig mit einem dahingehenden Kommentar bei uns!

 

Was kann ich zum Training mitbringen und was nicht?

Wir empfehlen Snacks und genügend Trinkbares dabeizuhaben, da das Training ein paar Stunden dauert. Empfehlenswert sind auch kleine Beschäftigungen wie Bücher, oder das Handy zum Daddeln, damit die Minuten im Versteck sich nicht zu sehr hinziehen.

Bitte bringt keine Haustiere zum Training mit, ohne das vorher abgesprochen zu haben!

 

Wie kann ich den Veranstalter kontaktieren, wenn ich Fragen habe?

Einfach eine E-Mail an berlin.mantrailer@gmail.com

 

Ist meine Registrierung übertragbar?

Im Grund spricht nichts dagegen. Wir bitten aber darum, die andere Person ausreichend über das Training und was von Helfern erwartet wird zu informieren.

description.html:
Die Schulung für die Performance Management-Experten, die selbstständig ETL-Prozesse gestalten wollen. Lernen Sie, wie Sie zukünftig an alle Daten im Unternehmen herankommen und diese optimal für Ihre Business Intelligence-Anwendung aufbereiten.

 

Ziel

Nach der Schulung arbeiten Sie sicher mit den grundlegen Mechanismen des Microsoft SQL Servers. Sie sind in der Lage, Ihre Daten zu beziehen und zu verändern und auch komplexere Abfragen und Problemstellungen zu lösen. Außerdem erlangen Sie Einblicke in die Administration und Sicherung von relationalen Datenbanken.

 

Zielgruppe

Anwender, Einsteiger in die MS SQL Server-Umgebung

 

Dauer

3 Tage

 

Inhalt im Detail

  • Relationales Datenbankdesign (Star-Schema)

  • SQL-Abfragen im SQL Management Studio

  • Structured Query Language (SQL): SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, ALTER, CREATE TABLE, GRANT, REVOKE

  • Tabellenverknüpfungen

  • Arbeiten mit Gruppenfunktionen

  • Unterabfragen (Sub-Queries)

  • Feldfunktionen

  • Views erstellen und bearbeiten

  • Sichern & Wiederherstellen von Datenbanken

  • Erstellung/Erweitern von Tabellen

  • Erstellung von Anmeldungen / Usern

  • Automatisierungen über die Integration Services

 

ATVISIO-Tipp

Ihre Zeit ist kostbar. Nehmen Sie an einem Kompakttraining teil und erlernen Sie den gleichen Schulungsinhalt in nur zwei Tagen. Rufen Sie uns hierzu an.

 

Weitere Informationen

Für Unternehmen kann dieses Training auch als Inhouse-Schulung durchgeführt werden. Bitte sprechen Sie hierzu Rebecca Schlesser an.
